rest\n\n\n*** After third session:\n\nthe PCs have decided to take a short rest after defeating Qesnef, however, they are being interrupted by SOMETHING.\n\nThey have explored all of the middle wing, and all of the west wing except for the floating stream room.\n\nTalia currently wields Blackrazor, and Pete has Wave in his pack.\n\nZa has an Armor of Vulnerability, which grants resistance to Slashing, and vulnerability to Bludgeoning and Piercing.\n\n*** Combat with Qesnef\n\n- Talia 16\n- KT 15\n- Elron 15\n- Pete 12\n- Qesnef 8 HP0\n- Za 2\n\n*** After Second Session\n\nPCs have reached the end of the metal-heating corridor and defeated the ghoul ambush, and just took a short rest.\n\nRoll Random Encounter 3 times, because I only rolled 3 times at the end of last session and I should have rolled 6.\n\nThey have been awake for about 2.5 hours.\n\n\n*** After First Session\nPCs have reached Snarla's Sanctum, and are attempting to Long Rest in a Leomund's Tiny Hut.\n\nAfter about 6 hours, two ogres enter the room (Snarla's Sanctum). They immediately see Burkett and Snarla, and after a short exchange help them out. Snarla directs them out into Burkett's room, and after a few minutes, a single ogre comes back in.\n\nIt looks a bit grumpy and walks over to the bed and sits on it. After it plops down it grimaces and rubs its behind.\n\nAfter half an hour, the ogre is back with a Knight and another ogre. The knight says \"Fucking Ogres\" and goes to cut Snarla out of her bounds.\n\nThe knight tells one of the ogres to go get the cask, and it leaves.\n\nHalf an hour after that, another ogre walks in carrying a large cask. He speaks.\n\nAdventurers. Mercenaries. Acquirers. I speak to you from across the planescape! An item of extreme; no, severe power, which was, until now, in my charge, has been misappropriated from my possession.\n\nI have reason to believe that it has made its way to your, uh, vicinity. Plane.\n\nBut I'm getting ahead of myself. My name is Ominifis Hereward Dran, Masked Lord of Waterdeep. You probably haven't heard of it. Regardless, I need your help.\n\nThe weapon is named Whelm. Now. I want to be clear at this juncture that it is NOT to be employed. Unless you're a dwarf. But probably not then, either. It is a warhammer of terrible power, and it must be protected.\n\nI believe it is in a locale known to your people as White Plume Mountain. I'm sure you'll be able to discern its location, but retrieving it may be another matter. It is being protected by the Mad Wizard Keraptis, notorious for his Madness. Also for traps. And mind-control. You get the idea.\n\nIf you are able to retrieve this relic, then to return it--uhh. (he looks \"off-screen\", and quickly exchanges some words with someone. He turns back). Try touching it to this disc? We'll figure it out.\n\n\n# RESEARCH RESULTS\n\n- There is a Vampire.\n- There is a werewolf held there against her will.\n- The dungeon is wet, and there is an underground lake inside of it.\n- Green Slime (burns through armor&body, scrape it off)"}},"items":[],"abilities":[],"classes":[]},"children":{"26 - Every minute you get to make the saving throw again. This is a maximum of 40 damage, avg 25 damage, between saves. If they fail the last one they will fall 60 feet before landing on the sloping wall of the tower.\n\nOf course, someone with the ability to fly would make this much, much easier. They could install a piton at the base of the terrace and reduce the DC of the checks to 3, 6, and 8.\n\n\n# The Egg Chamber\n\nOn top of the terrace the PCs will come across many thri-kreen with wings flitting to and fro, and largely ignoring the PCs. This is because they are Workers, winged females who only tend to the well-being of the Thri-Kreen Larva.\n\n# Arrival\n\nWhen the BBEG notices the PCs, it will say (telepathically):\n\nWHAT FOOLS YOU WERE TO LET THEM FOLLOW YOU.
